page.title: 19ALKHAM VILLAGERS ATTITUDES.
page.content: The villagers of Alkham were questioned about their life-styles and attitudes.Most chose to live in the village because of the beautiful and peaceful countryside and the friendly village atmosphere,many had lived in the village for most of their lives while others chose to retire to Alkham.Of the working inhabitants most travelled to Dover or Folkestone by car to pursue their careers.The local bus service was used by a few villagers regularly for shopping or to get to work or school, but most used it only occasionly or not at all. Shopping expeditions were equally divided between Dover or Folkestone. Most villagers listed gardening as their main hobby,with sports such as swimming and horse riding other favourite uses of spare time.Reading was popular amongst the elderly.
